intro: Singularybas oblongus, commonly known as the broadleaf spire, is a unique flowering plant characterized by its elongated, oval-shaped leaves. It belongs to the family Lepidocarpaceae and is native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are thick and waxy, which helps it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Singularybas oblongus is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
